website_summaries.verdict: An affordable multi-workout machine that lacks some key features.
pros: You can string together multiple exercises in just one sitting
cons: Not ideal for those over six feet or 250 pounds
Several users complain of locking pins falling out, which can be unsafe

customer_reviews.title: Very bad item, Defective!!
customer_reviews.text: Very bad item, Defective, Can not get pass the first step because the holes on the Foot Plates does not even align with the holes on Foot Support, No matter how hard you try to push it in, its not aligned and the Screws can not go in at all. Buy a different brand!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Not designed very well for assembly and safety concerns
customer_reviews.text: The Ab/Hyper shipped us is not exactly the same quality as the one we saw in the gym. Bench is too small for person with average built. The material for the bench is really flimsy and not durable. The other issue is the assembly tool that comes with this product is poorly designed. It's really difficult to fit the tools under the bench to tighten the rods that anchors the bench to the body. One of the tools that comes with this product has a sharp edge and it cut me during assembly. The other safety issue is that the stainless steel anchoring pin was lose during workout. We definitely don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Defective, UNSAFE do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: UNSAFE. This is ridiculous for this I put everythinv together the instructions were not clear I just put a squatters rack system the day before. I was hesitant about using it with the three locks pins that had no lock. Glad I was I slowly went to do the bent over back hyperextension and the front leg started sliding. Could of been real bad concrete and a garage. Do not buy this product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and versatile
customer_reviews.text: This bench is fine. Not the best one you'll find, but definitely not the worst either. It's sturdy, and its versatility allows you to do a lot of different workouts on it. The only downsides are 1) it's not super convenient to switch height settings - unlike most benches that have a knob thingy that slides up and down, this has pins you have to take out and put back in different spots; you have to feel it out to line up just right, and 2) I'm 5'9", yet my neck and head lie on the floor when I decline. Still doable for decline press and such, but it's not the most ideal setup.
customer_reviews.author: Trent S.

customer_reviews.title: Too Complicated and Cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but too complicated and cumbersome to have to adjust or close the heavy steel. If it was lightweight , it might be easier, but then it may not be able to hold certain body weight. Great idea for someone with large space who does not have to worry about closing or folding shut the exercise equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: I ordered Stamina Pro Ab/Hyper bench.. When I finally received it there was no hardware as in bolts etc. and see attached photo ... It's missing some cushions as well.👎
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and is pretty solid if you put it together correctly (advise to ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'9" not slim build male. We have this on carpet in our room so it doesn't seem to wobble. It does require assembly, and is pretty solid if you put it together correctly (advise to get a ratchet wrench and a crescent wrench for a speedier assembly). Use it mainly for sit ups and hyperextensions right now. Doing sit ups your head definitely hands off the bench, but I'd imagine most benches are like this. I like that it can be folded, but it isn't enough where I can slip it under our bed (we have a low bed though), but I can put it next to my desk and it isn't obtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: J-Chord

customer_reviews.title: There's gotta be better quality
customer_reviews.text: A joke. Holes for the screws don't even line up. There's gotta be better quality control
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble, easy to use and change positions. Have used it multiple times, as has my husband and have had no complaints so far. I've seen many comments about the L clips being unsafe because they could slide out during exercise, but they need to be able to come in and out for adjustments, and so far I have not noticed them budge one bit during mine or my husband's more vigorous workouts. we've only had it for a week but we like it a lot so far.
customer_reviews.author: CatherineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I was bit worried about the risk that this machine doesn't have extra safety pins which can give more security for the three locking pins like some people mentioned. After using this machine for few days so far, I haven't had any experience like some reviewers pointed out like locking pins pop out. Overall it seems very well made, and I like how heavy the metals frames are. Good quality and looks nice too. I'm very good with assemble furniture and things like that.. but this one took me almost an hour without anyone's help. You just need to have some patient and follow the instruction slowly. I'm Keeping it!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: This thing saved my back
customer_reviews.text: This probably saved me from not being able to walk due to my lower herniated discs. The decline sit ups is what helped the most. I was able to get my core muscles big enough so the pain went away with this thing. The backups are okay but not so much for my lower back. It seems to work out more of my middle back. I've been using it over a year and it's still in good condition. I bought another one for my second house.
customer_reviews.author: louis

customer_reviews.title: Great equipment for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly to strengthen my lower back. It arrived on time with all the parts needed. Assembly took me 45 min using my own tools. I highly suggest using a socket set and crescent wrench because the tools included will make it take longer. All of the holes lined up, and seems very solid. It is also easy to use as a preacher curl bench, which is easier on my lower back. Can’t beat the price. I’m 6 foot tall and weigh 235, and it supports me well. Haven’t tried the sit-up feature yet, but seems big enough to do it. Overall, I’m very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce M.

customer_reviews.title: What a set up.
customer_reviews.text: 1st- good product once you fix all their mistakes. Good luck doing this with limited tools. The 1st main support needed 2 1/2 moons cut out of the end to accept a round pipe on the other end and align bolt holes. Only one side was cut. Luckily I had cutters and grinders...but shouldn't of had to make this happen. Two dumb wrench tools with a phillips tack welded on. Make sure you have 2 cresent wrenches and a phillips. After balancing upside down to get the seat on...really neat piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Duxbury

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with no visible damage to box but item is ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with no visible damage to box but item is chipped and scratched in places and the hardware bag had a hole in it and is missing one of the bolts. So because it is a holiday weekend I'm going to have make a trip to the hardware store and buy one, as the manufactures' business is open only Mon-Fri reg business hours and who wants to wait, etc etc... Hassle!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great bench, well made, stable and I use it for Preacher Curls as well.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and easy to assemble. Not really sure why some of the comments mention difficult assembly as it only took a few minutes to put together. It is well made and is very stable i.e. it doesn't rock or move around when I am on it and I am not a small person. They should really add that it also works well as a Preacher Curl bench as that is why I bought it. If the cushions were 1-2 inches wider then it would be perfect but it still works very well for me and is a great addition to my home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Worst assembly process ever
customer_reviews.text: Absolute worst piece of equipment I’ve ever had to assemble, there were no instructions included so I had to use my phone to search for one and the directions were so difficult to follow. I’ve assembled so many things from stationary bikes, ellipticals, beds, dressers, TV stands. I actually enjoy assembling things. This was terrible tho. The little metal pieces that holds the bench in place and allow you to fold or adjust are just not long enough and easily move and slip out. I just would not recommend this, I would have rather spent a little more and had it pre assembled and been able to test quality before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: La_Chupacabraj

customer_reviews.title: Ok at best
customer_reviews.text: Good piece of equipment but not sturdy support wise. I had to weigh it down with sand bags to keep it from sliding on the floor. The adjustment pin for the bench part itself is also not easy to move around if you don't line up the metal piece just right you'll be there all day trying to adjust it and getting the pin in. Its a you get what you pay for situation.
customer_reviews.author: BittyBuffOz

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't come with written instructions! I had to find a pdf under product support here on Amazon. Holes in cushion are not evenly drilled and I was unable to screw in 2 of 4 screws required. I hope that it is still relatively safe and holds up. Appears to be a pretty good product despite the difficulty assembly. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer's Warranty is a RIP OFF
customer_reviews.text: The item is amazing and i enjoy using the product...BUT mine came damaged from warehouse deals of course. The bench piece itself as well as one of the smaller pads have small tears. Upon contacting Stamina to have the part replaced, I found out that the buyer is responsible for the shipping costs to send the damaged product to them to be inspected and IF approved then you are also responsible for the shipping cost to get the replacement. So basically it will cost me over half the total price of the item just to have what I initially PAID FOR....
customer_reviews.author: ChristiTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: great buy... it is a 2-fer!
customer_reviews.text: Great value... two apparatuses in one. Took look at other feedback and was concerned about "pins" coming loose, so drilled holes in them and inserted c.pins. (c o t t e r) ( I hate auto correct... ) sturdy bench and Roman chair. saves a lot of room. love it!
customer_reviews.author: Silverbelle

customer_reviews.title: Not great as a Roman Chair
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I purchased this item was to have a roman chair to exercise my back (as shown in the main picture of the item). Sadly the bench gets in the way of doing back hyperextensions with full range of motion. The item is pretty heavy so even though it folds up for easy storage moving it around will be difficult (perhaps that is the workout that the product provides)
customer_reviews.author: Sini

customer_reviews.title: Product is good..
customer_reviews.text: Product is good... but I am deducting one star for each of the followings: - missing 4 washers - tools supplied for assembly are poor. I would recommend using your own DIY tools - assembling the Ankle Support piece to the frame (particularly with insert washers) is not straight forward. Some turning/twisting + luck is needed!
customer_reviews.author: matrix

customer_reviews.title: very stable
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with how stable this bench is. Solid build, easy to set up and adjust when using too. Only down side is the length of the bench would have been nicer if it had been a little longer. (that is just personal preference) I would recommend this bench to others.
customer_reviews.author: Moses

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent product, though definitely not what I would call HEAVY DUTY. If you not expecting professional gym level quality, you will be happy. It is certainly functional, and offers a variety of workout options if you are homebound, either forced or voluntarily. I would recommend this product, though only for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product, does it's job, installation issues
customer_reviews.text: One of the holes was not in line with the hole across from it. I had to use my Dremel to grind out the hole. The bench isn't long, when I do sit-ups on it my shoulders hang off, but it isn't that big of a deal. For the price I like it and I'm not disappointed. It is just the right size for my apartment.
customer_reviews.author: radcalibrator

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality and not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Just received it today, and already, it was so hard to put together. I could tell the product is made cheap. Just to adjust, you have to unscrew and screw bolts which takes extra steps and not convenient while doing your workout. I’d probably just rather pay more for a better quality ab bench. Will be returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Torreon

customer_reviews.title: The company should put one of these together
customer_reviews.text: Really Love this bench, but putting it together with the bolts that were provided was a challenge since all but 1 was too long therefore nothing was tightening up due to the bolts only tightening to a certain point. The company should put one of these together and figure out a solution, the right parts for a start.
customer_reviews.author: first tenneesee

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy awesome christmas present.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it is exactly what my man wanted, it was relatively easy to put together. It came with tools, if you don't have your own toolset, use them, they work. It took 2 people to put this together because I'm kinda weak but it was really easy! No problems with the bench either, it is strong. The spokes that hold the bench in place seem short, but it has never fallen out when exercising.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son and I put the bench together last night and was very excited.....BUT when we went to place the very last bolt in (Part # 18) we fould that the bolt had not been threaded so we are not able to complete the assembly. I have not yet been able to get in touch with Stamina to ask for a replacement part. We have been very disappointed and are awaiting their return email.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustom909

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of gym equipment
customer_reviews.text: My husband & I put this together in about 30mins. Love that it folds flat for easy storage. Found it easy to maneuver & adjust for various workout needs. This was a great purchase to add to my in home workout collection!
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn D.

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5'4" with a small frame and this works great for me
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'4" with a small frame and this works great for me. The only caveat is that the pins can come off easily. I secured the pin adjusting the incline with 3 wrist bands. I check that the pin remains in place before using the bench.
customer_reviews.author: Ro Yanis

customer_reviews.title: Working Out Back Problems...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a bad back and needed to do some lower back (latissimus dorsi) exercises to build its strength. This bench is perfect for that. I lock myself in, hold a weight, and lower my upper body down, then back up. I also do decline ab exercises. I am 6'2". The bench is a bit short for the situps, but I can tuck my head and I'm fine. (Thankfully I do my exercises on carpet.) It would be nice it it was a bit longer, but there are plenty of applications it can be used for the way it is.
customer_reviews.author: Foz

customer_reviews.title: I've been looking for something like this for many months and this is the only ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a one of a kind bench. I've been looking for something like this for many months and this is the only bench that I found for home use where I can do many core workouts that I previously had to go to the gym to get done. The bench was easy to put together and is sturdy even with my husband's weight (he's a strong 230 lbs). Unfortunately this bench only gets four stars because of my husband's height. He's 5'11" and feels that it the bench is a little too small for someone of his height to workout comfortably on a daily basis. Satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Unable to assemble product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product, but since I am unable to get past step 1 to assemble it I had to contact customer service. It took a couple tries before I heard back from them and I was told they would look for a replacement part. I have another product from this company and it is solid so I was surprised that I got a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely designed for a very small person. I am ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely designed for a very small person. I am 5'4" 130lbs female/ personal trainer and find this product near dysfunctional for my small frame. Save your money and invest in something higher quality with larger dimensions. The bench does not extend far enough to support my head when doing abdominal work.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Harter

customer_reviews.title: Good bench
customer_reviews.text: Not quite like the one I was use to working out on but it suffices. It has plenty of adjustment settings so it works for me (5'2") and for my hubby (6'). The only thing that would have made me vote 5 stars on this is if the ab pads were more comfortable. The spacing between them is just enough to make it uncomfortable but I use a towel or whatever I have handy to fill the gap. It does not hinder me using it. Other than that it is an inexpensive and good hyperextension bench.
customer_reviews.author: N. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: truly love this one!
customer_reviews.text: I have returned several benches for various design flaws but have finally found the perfect one for my needs. This is by far the best unit in its price range, and in fact its stability rivals some benches in the $400-500 range. Construction is solid, set up is easy, and the placement of the pads and rollers are perfect and highly adjustable. In fact the rollers are fully 180 degrees adjustable so one can use them to hook one's feet while doing situps, or use them behind one's calves as seen in the picture. The bench is a bit short - it only extends to midback during situps but it's not really a big issue.
customer_reviews.author: ippowus

customer_reviews.title: A couple of flaws but still a good bench.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bench for the petite body frame. Im 5"2 so it works for me. I dont like how the pins that are used for adjusting slip out while the bench is in use. Very dangerous!!! I took it to a steel place and had them drill holes in the pin and put clamps on them so they lock in place. The other issue is the lack of ease when changing the position of the bench for a different workout. It takes a while because i have to line the holes up just right for the pins to fit in.
customer_reviews.author: lechelle

customer_reviews.title: The picture directions were vary easy to follow and the product is really good quality
customer_reviews.text: The picture directions were vary easy to follow and the product is really good quality..... The product folds away very nicely and it was a recommendation to purchase a roman chair from my doctor in order to strengthen my back. When I was looking for a Roman Chair it was important to have a Foot Rest to assure my feet stay in place..... If you look at this picture it's hard to tell if there is a place for your feet but when I received it I was pleasantly surprised that there is
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’8”, 190 lb man. It is a perfect size. It is solid and was easy to build. I only gave it 4 stars for stability because the base is small but it’s not really a problem. The small base makes it compact for storage.
customer_reviews.author: HHaller

customer_reviews.title: Bench is very sturdy. There was a big issue when putting together
customer_reviews.text: Bench is very sturdy. There was a big issue when putting together. the tool that came with it was a "multi purpose" it was used to fit together different equipment. this was a problem because the wrench part needed to tighten the bolts was too long and would hit other bolts or items on the bench. making assembly difficult and i scratched my knuckles quite a few times. Nothing like blood sweat and tears when putting together a workout bench :)
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: great bench
customer_reviews.text: works great and I can easily do hyperextensions and sit ups. The only cons are that the pins fall out easily when putting it away for storage, and when adjusting the height for my wife, the paint is starting to scrape off. Overall the main focus of this is to get some good exercises in and this gets the job done while feeling sturdy and securely holding in your legs / feet.
customer_reviews.author: niloc

customer_reviews.title: good for your back
customer_reviews.text: It took more than a little effort to put it together and was missing one screw. It was hard to line up all 4 holes to get the seat to attach. Once that struggle was over it has been fine. I am 5'8" and 240 lbs and the size for me is just fine. It feels sturdy, does not wiggle or wobble and is just right for me to do the back extension shown in the picture. It might be small for a taller person but for me it is what I need at a reasonable price. My back feels stronger already.
customer_reviews.author: Gashrink

customer_reviews.title: I am 5'11" and 180-200 lbs.  I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: The bench is sturdy and doesn't wobble unless it is compared to the large solid weld benches at the gym. It collapses quickly to store-away or carry down the hallway to the living to do sit-ups periodically all night long. I added one piece of cloth (a sock) to the buffer the clank of the feet holder. When you remove your feet, the foot holder clanks as it drops. No big deal, but it can be startling.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Walker

customer_reviews.title: better than expected for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special, but I do like this bench. I purchased it for lower back exercise and it's works well for me. Do be sure to make sure the pins are fully inserted before workout (my only minor complaint - I feel they should have supplied a better holding pin, maybe with a spring ball so it couldn't possibly wiggle out, but that's a minor knock for me, I just check 'em each time I go to use it )
customer_reviews.author: Evans

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Im 200 lbs. So keep that mind. Once assembled the product is very sturdy. U can do a multitude of excersizes on this thing. No wobbling or anything from the product. Great for sit ups or side crunches or even back excercises. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevilladakilla

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good quality, affordable
customer_reviews.text: It's really sturdy, can't beat it at the price point,. Some people complained about holes not aligning with bolts etc. I had zero problems with the setup. I wish the folding was easier, but I'm really satisfied with the purchase. I am a slim female, not sure how it would hold up to someone 200 lb plus.
customer_reviews.author: Izabela D.

customer_reviews.title: worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The machine is very solid..does not..rock when used even at lowest setting for sit ups. The hyperextension works well even for my height..im 6'3 The only reason for 4 stars is the assembly instructions are pathetic and tested my patience..lol Only other concern is that the lock pins seem a little on the short side. All in all this is a very sturdy piece of equipment abd a great bang for buck purchase.
customer_reviews.author: FLDIVERJC

customer_reviews.title: Great workout Bench
customer_reviews.text: Great workout bench. Truly great work for abs, glutes, back, chest and arms. Very good quality, durable material. Folds up easy when you want it out of the way. Assembly instructions could use some work. Multiple steps shown on each diagram is a bit confusing. Would be simple to just have a diagram for each step. Bottom line, it’s a great workout with lots of exercise options on a compact, well made durable bench. Five Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Holes were drilled in wrong places and we cant put it together. Not made well at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Castranova III

customer_reviews.title: Home training
customer_reviews.text: I do like the product. I wish the bench itself was a bit longer. It does feel stable however even with the pin it shakes.. not to mention slipped out a few times. But over all I do like it
customer_reviews.author: S. lee

customer_reviews.title: GOOD VALUE AND HEAVY DUTY, SOLID
customer_reviews.text: Real heavy duty, even for 240 pounds, 6 feet. Hold pins in (especially if no more adjustments) to make sure pin does not fall out with workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff789

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: Returning item bc can't get past second step due to holes not drilled correctly. Should have been suspicious of the multiple retaped box because that is what I did to return it. Unable to thread screws.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic addition to my home gym!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't wait for this to arrive! Delivery was supposed to be about 6 days but I had it within 3! My husband set it up within a half hr (with the slight assistance of our 8 year old son) and once assembled I was thrilled! This bench will be able to replace my decline bench and flat bench all together. I am 5'6" at 145lbs and my husband is 6' at 225lbs and this is a perfect for for both of us. Allows for a great variety of workouts and doesn't take up a bunch of space. I've all ready recommended this product to other friends that workout from home frequently. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: JPSjrJohnson911

customer_reviews.title: Good bench, but...
customer_reviews.text: As was said by others, pins have tendency to slide and fall out eventually, unless they're pushed in periodically. Had these pins came with a stopper, that wouldn't be happening. These are M10 (metric, 10mm) pins. You can find good "push button" M10 pins with a stopper, but they are very expensive. Each pin would cost you around $30. If anyone is interested, you can purchase such pins at  You would need MTACH-10-070 (70mm) pins for two front holes. For the hole underneath the bench, you probably want to go with slightly longer pin: MTACH-10-080 (80mm).
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail Kuperblum

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Assemble was not easy because didn't get the right parts. It's a waste of money since we can't use it! Too heavy to send back. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ruji

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my husband and I. It adjusts easily and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Ac1234

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, multi-use
customer_reviews.text: The reason I love this bench.. it's sturdy and easy to assemble. It's perfect height and I can use it in so many different ways. A really good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Effarah

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: This bench is very versatile and suites everything I wanted and more, I would maybe not recommend it for people over 6 feet tall. My husband and I use it daily , but my son is 6'2" and found the bench too small for his stature.
customer_reviews.author: wv

customer_reviews.title: I was about 220lbs when I bought and used it ...
customer_reviews.text: I was about 220lbs when I bought and used it. After few situps it fell appart because the triangle metal piece at the main joint just bent outward. The fact that I could bend it back with simple pliers was not encouraging either. Maybe I should have paid a few dollars more?
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: ... husband & I use this & it works just fine. Things we noticed the pins come out easily ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband & I use this & it works just fine. Things we noticed the pins come out easily & could get lost & when we use the decline our heads are on the floor but we don't mind we use it at our house (we are both around 5 7) & are happy with our purchase
customer_reviews.author: christina miller

customer_reviews.title: Solid bench for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bench is relatively solid for the cheap price point. I'm 6 foot and 200 lb and it holds me well. Adjustment is a little difficult, but holds my weight fine. My main complaint is that the pins don't have a cotter pin or some sort of cap to lock the pin from sliding out. It's fine as long as you remember to check the pins each time you use it. Overall, I'd buy it again as I only use it for ab exercises and it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S.

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile product!
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a back extension machine... I found this very versatile machine that can be used for a wide variety of exercises! Be sure to look at the product photos - they include preacher curls and a decline ab bench, among others. The product was easy to assemble, and is also very easy to adjust for different exercises. I have been a fitness enthusiast and personal trainer for years, and I am very pleased to find such a great product (that also easily folds up when not in use).
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I ended up having to have my handyman put it together, very difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.author: J. Curry

customer_reviews.title: Great for muscle building in legs
customer_reviews.text: It is great for those of us recovering from a Total Hip Replacement ( 8 months to 1 year post-op)
customer_reviews.author: Dr. D.

customer_reviews.title: Good Exercise Bench
customer_reviews.text: Wife and I have been using it. We love this bench.
customer_reviews.author: ALL4MANU

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to put together using 11/16 wrench n socket
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to put together using 11/16 wrench n socket. Solid construction. I purchased for hyper extension and it is ideal for that. The bench works for inside seated curls because it is not wide enough for a wide grip. Overall the Bench is solid n has a good platform for home use. For the price you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Love love love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is my super favorite. Though pouring it together was not pleasant it wasn't too bad. One screw on the seat didn't line up so I left it out and seams to work fine without it. I love the workouts I feel stronger already and I left it in my living room so every time I go by I do a workout. Is great love the back extentions.
customer_reviews.author: Abby L. Nesheim

customer_reviews.title: Hazard - Replace the pins with locking pins or they can come out and youll fall to the floor when bench collapses!!
customer_reviews.text: Someone else had the same issue I did. One of the pins came loose and sent me smashing to the floor and cutting my knuckles pretty badly and jamming my wrist. Locking pins would be a simple fix to this potentially dangerous equipment. Otherwise its a nice bench. Ill be replacing the pins before I continue to use. It probably deserves more than a 2 rating but someone could easily hurt themselves a lot worse than I did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good machine -bad assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with my purchase as I know I will use it often. The assembly was slightly difficult due to instructions being confusing. But overall good product and easy to store when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Wallace

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT!! Had to modify it however as it would not completely close up. Swivel Piece connecting from main bench bar standing bar would catch and rip into the bench. I had to take a dremel and cut off the corners so it would clear the bench when folding. Other than that, its a solid piece for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Samie VanGilder

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice piece of equipment. The knee pads are of sufficient cushion and the overall construction is solid. It's also a phenomenal design. However, the padding on the seat cushion should be thicker first and foremost. I would also agree that it is dangerous having a locking pin (which doesn't actually lock and is not easy to get in and out), rather than a hitch pin (which would do both), for the seat adjustment. But, what would be really great is if the company designed this bench with a quick release pin for the handlebar post, so it could be transitioned quicker. Those fixes would make this a perfect bench.
customer_reviews.author: bdub1976

customer_reviews.title: It's sturdy and folds up!
customer_reviews.text: It's a good thing this machine folds up because I realized I was pregnant soon after we got it. I did get to use it before as I love doing back hyperextension exercises. It doesn't wobble at all like some of these machines do. It is heavier, but still easy enough to move around. I'm 5'4" and at the time weighed around 130 lbs and found it very easy to use. Can't wait to use it again after the baby arrives. :)
customer_reviews.author: Milla Pen

customer_reviews.title: I love this bench
customer_reviews.text: I love this bench. I can do my workout on the bench. It is sturdy for my 200Lb frame. Just be careful with the pins as they may slip out and cause an accident. Otherwise bench is great
customer_reviews.author: JO

customer_reviews.title: Pretty simple to put together, sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Simple enough to put together...gives me some options that using the floor doesn’t, and keeps me from having to get on the floor for basic sit-ups etc.
customer_reviews.author: Megaman

customer_reviews.title: Compact and adjustable - great value!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very please with this one. It's quite compact and works perfectly as a roman chair, and some weight bench uses. I bought another roman chair that was very large and heavy duty, but totally un-adjustable. This one adjusts to a perfect setting for me. Now I just have to make it a point to use it every day . . . :-)
customer_reviews.author: L-G-Ver

customer_reviews.title: But this one
customer_reviews.text: Only negative aspect to this product is the locking bar that positions the seat, but a bolt and nut to properly secure it, do not trust what is provided, when in use it slips out. Other than that solid peice of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler Selhorn

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality and sturdy bench, I wish the padding was thicker
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality and sturdy bench, I wish the padding was thicker, and those pins are not safety pins and are a disaster waiting to happen, so I bought pins that lock.
customer_reviews.author: P. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: but overall I really like this piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I am 6' and 125 lbs and the bench is durable during workouts. The bench portion is cutting it kind of close, I wish it were a few inches longer, but overall I really like this piece of equipment. Assembly was easy enough and took about half an hour. This is a good value for its price. It is not gym-grade, however, it is good if all you need is a basic decline bench. I am happy with the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Oddisey Knox

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t take much room. It is perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something that didn’t take much room. I just love it!
customer_reviews.author: Helga

customer_reviews.title: Good product; however
customer_reviews.text: Good product; however, some parts can be made a little better. For example, on the legs, the bar keeps slipping after tightening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price but the bench holes do not line up correctly.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty decent for the price, the only problem is that the holes for the screws made for the bench doesn't line up correctly. Here are the photos i have taken.
customer_reviews.author: Ryder

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble by husband with wrenches and Phillips screwdriver ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived to my door by post office truck and packaged well. Easy to assemble by husband with wrenches and Phillips screwdriver and surprised how sturdy it is. Handles 240 meathead husband and smaller females. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: jenelle

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for my home gym...Store it on my treadmill when not using. Can do a lot of ab and low back work,
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Moderate quality from PRC
customer_reviews.text: Moderate build quality. Padding on the bench is insufficient. Padding on the thigh pads is OK. Made in PRC
customer_reviews.author: Rainy Dan

customer_reviews.title: Love this! It was fairly easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Love this! It was fairly easy to assemble. (My husband did it :~)) I bought it specifically to do the exercise in the ad. It is very sturdy and effective. I am only 5'2" and was a little concerned it would not work. But it is perfect even for my size.
customer_reviews.author: cmsbmff

customer_reviews.title: awesome! A+
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried since i'm pretty tall 6'0. My head hangs out and a little bit of my shoulder but no big deal. You can clearly use this without a problem. Everything came with the right amount pieces. It took me solid 30 minutes to build the equipment together. i just wish there was a better holder to change the levels of the equipment. This product is overall awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: when your age is creaking up there it makes it easy to do maneuvers that help keep you in shape ...
customer_reviews.text: this is body beneficial and it helps your lower back become very strong along with your abdomen. when your age is creaking up there it makes it easy to do maneuvers that help keep you in shape and strong. very sturdy.. oh and easy to adjust... i love it
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Good bench for the price. I think it will last.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and sturdy. Yes, the pins can slide out. Just check them before each set. I really appreciate the split cushion. Using this also exposed my faults in my bicep curls. Nice bench for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Headphone guy

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed and I've had a few good lower back workouts
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is that it is just a bit hard on my front hip area (just a tiny bit), but that is probably my issue. Works as designed and I've had a few good lower back workouts. Easy to put together and heeded the warning on the safety clips and purchased some better clips (haven't had an incident, but it does look a bit unsafe).
customer_reviews.author: Jfull

customer_reviews.title: Works better than many I have used at gyms.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. My wife would say she couldn't do sit ups because it hurt her back and she uses it regularly for both sit ups and reverse sit ups.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Nagel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, It took us about an hour to set it up, and I had to use some of my tools. But overall, great deal !
customer_reviews.author: Ranarch

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and works well.  Pins can fal out
customer_reviews.text: Wish it locked when putting in the medal pins but besides that it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M DAngiolillo

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I'm really overly happy with this purchase!! I use it in the garage gym almost daily and haven't had any issues! Abs and booty!! This will get you there!
customer_reviews.author: GymJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Best available for price
customer_reviews.text: Good versatility. Would be even better if the back board and supporting portions were a foot longer, to accommodate taller people. I'm 5 foot 8 and found it to be barely long enough. But can't rest head on board between sets, ends up on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Tomsik

customer_reviews.title: Good workout.
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint was with the adjustment pins. Somewhat cumbersome to install and left the adjusted piece loose. Would prefer something spring loaded with a tightening device. The machine otherwise delivers the exercises as advertised. Good workout.
customer_reviews.author: Vigilant Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and great as a roman chair and ab bench ...
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and great as a roman chair and ab bench but wish it was longer. I'm 5'7 and can't lay on it with my head supported which would be great for doing flys and presses and make it truly multi-functional. Considering the price and what you CAN do with it though, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ong

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, and ‘compact’
customer_reviews.text: I prefer a sit-up bench to secure your feet, for the stand-up core exercise. For sit-ups, the nench is great!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Petrenko

customer_reviews.title: good product, to train my AB
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product to train my AB, I like it I put it in the living room so I can do it anytime I feel like to exercise.
customer_reviews.author: FrankT

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it to me.
customer_reviews.text: This works fine. Is very sturdy. However, it is hard to use for sit-ups. The bench is too small to really use. If I could do over again I would just but a less expensive single function Roman Bench.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Emm

product_meta.title: Stamina Pro Ab/Hyper Bench
product_meta.description:
The Stamina Ab/Hyper Bench gives you terrific core strength, ripped abs and powerful back muscles. Work your upper and middle abs in four crunch positions ranging from flat to a 30 degree decline. The pull of a pin quickly and easily adjusts the angle of the bench to increase or decrease your workout intensity.

Target your lower back muscles with standing hyperextension exercises. The Ab/Hyper Bench's thigh support adjusts to fit your leg length, and the pivoting foam rollers hold your ankles securely so your body is aligned in the correct workout position. Non-slip rubber frame caps also protect floors
feature_bullets: Thickly padded bench with durable stitched vinyl upholstery
Adjustable, split thigh support. Recommended use- Use with or without dumbbells for ripped abs and a strong back
Pivoting foam rollers hold your lower leg in place for hyperextension exercises, and feet in place for crunches
High-density foam pads add comfort and support
Adjustable footrest, backrest, and thigh support to accommodate height and workout intensity
